channel.title: Blog on loualiche misc.
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on loualiche misc.

item.title: Using DuckDB with Julia
item.description: Some data tasks can be conveniently outsourced to DuckDB instead of using DataFrames. I go over the bindings and how I use it from within Julia.

item.title: TAQ Consolidated
item.description: For a recent revision, I have had to dig into TAQ data; I did not want to use SAS and I thought a combination of command line unix tools and julia would be easy. I learned a few things!

item.title: ST-Julia-IDE
item.description: I have been asked how to set up a simple Julia IDE (not VSCode) for people who are already using Sublime Test. There are a few things that need to line up for it to work smoothly. I wrote these steps down.

item.title: DataFrames and datatable
item.description: A guide for moving between Julia’s DataFrames.jl and R data.table. This follows the template of stata2r and gives side by side matches of common operation for data wrangling.

item.title: KP-Fstats-Julia
item.description: There are (were?) some issues with F-statistics estimation in stata for IV regressions. We simulate data to reproduce the problem and present a fix in the julia FixedEffectModels.jl library.

item.title: TikZ-Options
item.description: Some pictures in TikZ for my JF paper on Asset Pricing with Entry and Imperfect Competition: (i) a stylized Hopenhayn model; (ii) a Hotelling-Salop circle; (iii) some demand elasticity curves.

item.title: TikZ-Options
item.description: Some pictures in TikZ for our JFE paper on Bubbles and the Value of Innovation: (i) a picture of detailed disagreement (favorite); (ii) standard blocks of an equilibrium model with heterogeneous firms.

item.title: TikZ-Investments
item.description: Some pictures in TikZ for teaching a standard course on investment: (i) Capital Allocation Line (CAL); (ii) Efficient Frontier and Optimal CAL; (iii) Security Market Line; (iv) the link between the optimal CAL and the SML; (v) Treynor-Black portfolio selection.

item.title: TikZ-MWE
item.description: A minimal working example to integrate the TikZ and PGFPlots pictures I collected here.

item.title: TikZ-Discussions
item.description: Some pictures in TikZ for discussions of papers I have done: (i) utility in prospect theory.

item.title: TikZ-Options
item.description: Some pictures in TikZ for teaching a standard course on options and derivatives: (i) Payoffs of a forward contract; (ii) Covered Interest Parity.
